Description:
Everything is converging on the Internet, making networked connections more relevant than ever before in our lives. Our employees' revolutionary ideas impact everything imaginable from entertainment, retail, healthcare, and education, to public and private sectors, smart cities, smart cars, and everyday devices in our homes. Here, that means you'll take creative ideas from the drawing board to powerful solutions that have real-world impact. You'll work with Cisco leaders, partner with experienced mentors, and develop incredible relationships with colleagues who share your interest in connecting the unconnected. You'll be part of a team that cares about its customers, enjoys having fun, and will part in changing the lives of those in our local communities. Come prepared to be inspired.Business Analyst - Inventory OptimizationWe are seeking a skilled and analytical Inventory Optimization Business Analyst to join our team. In this role, you will be responsible for analyzing Supply chain data, identifying trends, and providing actionable insights to optimize inventory levels and enhance overall operational efficiency. The ideal candidate should possess strong analytical abilities, a Broder supply chain knowledge, and a deep understanding of inventory management processes.High-level responsibilitiesThe global process owner for Inventory Optimization initiatives and process across the Supply Chain providing actionable insights on Inventory projections and Excess. Proactively address excess inventory by utilizing industry best practices such as advance planning and inventory segmentation to provide prescriptive insights to OPT and regional Operations teams.
Help develop, implement, and manage Proactive inventory Management process. Reporting both process progress and ending results across a broad Cisco and Manufacturing Partner audience.
Ability to work on descriptive, predictive, and prescriptive analytics, generate comprehensive reports and presentations to communicate insights, recommendations, and strategies for inventory optimization.
Participate in the design and implementation of inventory management systems, contributing to process improvements and automation initiatives.
Work both globally and cross-functionally with Manufacturing Operations, Finance, CM partners, and Supply Chain Operations teams.QualificationHolds BS/Engineering or equivalent Degree, plus 4+ Supply Chain experience. APICS Certification is a plus. MBA is an added advantage.
Strong proficiency in data analysis, using tools such as Excel, SQL, and data visualization software.
Familiarity with inventory management software and systems; experience with ERP systems is advantageous.
Ability to communicate complex topics to a wide audience.
Must be self-motivated. Requires strong detail-oriented program management and influencing skills to work in a broad Global environment.
Excellent oral and written communication skills to effectively interact with internal and external stakeholders.
Understanding of ERP systems, BOM structure, inventory management systems, and processes
